text: Edward Gibbon (1707–1770) was an 18th-century English MP: for Petersfield from 1734 to 1741;'One hundred years of a pocket borough: Petersfield and Parliament, 1685-1783' Surry, N. p20: Petersfield; Petersfield Area Historical Society (Paper No. 7); 1983 and Southampton from 1741 to 1747.Craig, F. W. S. (ed.). The Parliaments of England (2nd ed.). Chichester: Parliamentary Research Services. pp. 134–136. . Gibbon was the only son of Edward Gibbon of Putney and his wife Catherine née Acton. He was educated at Westminster School and Emmanuel College, Cambridge;Alumni Cantabrigienses: A Biographical List of All Known Students, Graduates and Holders of Office at the University of Cambridge, from the Earliest Times to 1900, John Venn/John Archibald Venn Cambridge University Press > (10 volumes 1922 to 1953) Part I. 1209-1751 Vol. ii Chalmers – Fytche (1944) p208 after which he did the Grand Tour. On 3 June 1736 he married Judith née Porten: their son became the historian Edward Gibbon.D. M. Low, Edward Gibbon. 1737–1794 (London: Chatto & Windus, 1937), p. 7. Judith died in December 1747; and on 8 April 1755 he married secondly Dorothea née Patten.History of Parliament On-line ==References== Category:18th-century English people Category:Alumni of Emmanuel College, Cambridge Category:People educated at Westminster School, London Category:British MPs 1734–1741 Category:1707 births Category:1770 deaths
title: Edward Gibbon (died 1770)
